full_summary:
Tsiigehtchic Parcel Surveys
=====================================

### Contract Details

| Field Name | Field Value |
| --- | --- |
| Contract Title | Tsiigehtchic Parcel Surveys |
| Solicitation Number | 23139-230177/A |
| Reference Number | PW-NCS-101-12310 |
| Tender Closing Date | 20 September 2022, 16:00 local time |
| Expected Contract Start Date | Not specified |
| Expected Contract End Date | Not specified |

### Notice Information

This is a request for proposal (RFP) under the Competitive – Open Bidding procurement method.

### Services Required

The Natural Resources Canada, Surveyor General Branch, Northwest Territories Regional Office has a requirement for parcel surveys of Gwich'in Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement (GCLCA) boundary parcels.

### Security Requirements

There are no security requirements associated with this project.

### Indigenous Business Strategy

This procurement is conditionally set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). To be considered, the bidder must certify that they qualify as an Indigenous business as defined by PSIB and agree to comply with its requirements.

### Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement

This project is subject to the Gwich'in Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement (1992).

### Project Description

The desired outcome of this project is to survey the boundaries of artificial parcels nearest to Tsiigehtchic, Northwest Territories. The contracts include a comprehensive survey of all artificial boundaries and preparation of a plan of survey or compiled plan and associated field notes of survey suitable for registration at the Land Titles Office for each of the parcels 19, 29, 30, N, R, S, and T.

### Contract Period

The work is expected to be completed by 31 March 2023.

### Tender Submission

Eligible bidders can submit their proposals electronically. All tender documents can be downloaded from the Bid resultados ProjectLink Canada website.

### Contact Information

For any inquiries or clarifications regarding this RFP, please contact:
Ashley Tegart
Procurement Specialist
